data.author: Swisskid

changelog.release_notes: Fixed small bug that required you to exit the app to refresh your settings.

A few bugs, but configuration and stuff works. 
Really just works with devices and scenes. Thermostats don't work, and I don't have any sensors.

data.description:
Insteon control
Not functioning for everyone, and I haven't been able to find the source of the issue. Only reason it's up is because the users who it *was* functioning for requested I leave it up.
This app uses Insteon's API, letting you control your home lights and scenes. I wanted to stop looking for my phone when I wanted to activate my "Movies" scene, or when I wanted to turn the house off as I went to bed, so I wrote this. 

Directions:
Start by setting up the config inside the Pebble app on your phone.
When selecting a device or scene, a short press turns it on, long press is off.

NOTE:
One user has informed the the config option did not work for them. Please let me know by email or on IRC if you hit the same issue, and I'll be happy to help diagnose it. 

Compatibility:
This app is only compatible with the Hub 2 (2245-222) since Insteon's API doesn't work with the others.

Notes:
I named my Insteon API key account "TBD" because I never planned on actually publishing an app.
The shown pictures are lame, because the app isn't very featured yet, and I currently don't have plans for it to become much more featured. 

Known Bugs/Issues:
- Does not show current status
- 2-device wall outlets will only control the top outlet (This is a limitation of the API)
- Nothing outside of lights/outlets works (no thermostat, remote sensors, etc. Known issue with the API)

Feel free to contact me with comments/bugs/suggestions. I also idle in the #insteon and #pebble channels on Freenode as swiss.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed small bug that required you to exit the app to refresh your settings.

data.title: Insteon Control
